attributes.action: Allow for full tax relief on childcare costs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Childcare for my two children costs £1,200 per month, 50% of my take home salary. I do not have a private nanny, just a registered childminder who I share with two other families. I am not entitled to any 'working families' benefits etc. 

All I can get is a voucher worth £55 per week from my employer which I can offset against my taxable income. The voucher system is highly bureaucratic and since inception has engendered a whole industry of agencies offering to manage the system on behalf of employers. The maximum allowable weekly voucher value is £55 whether the family has one child or six children. 

A simpler, more effective and less bureaucratic system would enable the full costs of childcare to be eligible for tax relief (to a reasonable level).
